title: Deadline’s ‘SNL50: The Anniversary Special’ Live Blog
description: Live from New York, it’s Sunday night. The 50th anniversary of Saturday Night Live kicks off this evening at 8 p.m. ET/5 p.m. PT, the hottest ticket in town in years with a star-studded lineup including Alec Baldwin, Adam Sandler, Amy Poehler, Chevy Chase, Chris Rock, Dave Chappelle, Eddie Murphy, Garrett Morris, Jane Curtin, Jason […]
author: Patrick Hipes
excerpt: The 50th anniversary of Saturday Night Live kicks off Sunday, February 16 at 8 p.m. ET/5 p.m. PT, the hottest ticket in New York City.
text: Live from New York, it’s Sunday night. The 50th anniversary of Saturday Night Live kicks off this evening at 8 p.m. ET/5 p.m. PT, the hottest ticket in town in years with a star-studded lineup including Alec Baldwin, Adam Sandler, Amy Poehler, Chevy Chase, Chris Rock, Dave Chappelle, Eddie Murphy, Garrett Morris, Jane Curtin, Jason Sudeikis, , Kim Kardashian, Kristen Wiig, Pete Davidson, Paul McCartney, Paul Simon, Robert De Niro, Tina Fey, Tom Hanks and Will Ferrell set to appear among others. The show follows SNL50: The Homecoming Concert, which saw performances from the likes of Cher, the Backstreet Boys, Miley Cyrus, David Byrne and the surviving members of Nirvana. Expect to see a few classic sketches brought back to life as well as some of the most A-list cameos since the 40th anniversary. Watch on Deadline It’s a big night for Lorne Michaels, who recently said that he doesn’t feel done with the show, as well as NBCUniversal. Deadline will be covering all of the sketches and big moments below, so follow along.
html:
Live from New York, it’s Sunday night.

The 50th anniversary of Saturday Night Live kicks off this evening at 8 p.m. ET/5 p.m. PT, the hottest ticket in town in years with a star-studded lineup including Alec Baldwin, Adam Sandler, Amy Poehler, Chevy Chase, Chris Rock, Dave Chappelle, Eddie Murphy, Garrett Morris, Jane Curtin, Jason Sudeikis, , Kim Kardashian, Kristen Wiig, Pete Davidson, Paul McCartney, Paul Simon, Robert De Niro, Tina Fey, Tom Hanks and Will Ferrell set to appear among others.

The show follows SNL50: The Homecoming Concert, which saw performances from the likes of Cher, the Backstreet Boys, Miley Cyrus, David Byrne and the surviving members of Nirvana.

Expect to see a few classic sketches brought back to life as well as some of the most A-list cameos since the 40th anniversary.

Watch on Deadline

It’s a big night for Lorne Michaels, who recently said that he doesn’t feel done with the show, as well as NBCUniversal.

Deadline will be covering all of the sketches and big moments below, so follow along.
